name: The Boys Are Back
description: A sports writer becomes a single parent in tragic circumstances.
keywords: half brother, barefoot boy, gender in title, writer, parenthood

review.author: mooveephantom
review.heading: Effective and Moving Drama
review.reviewBody: Clive Owen shines once again as husband and father dealing with loss. Although the story seems like the familiar one we have seen before in many films like this, the direction, script and acting really do go through the many complexities of the characters. Scott Hicks shows us how flawed the father is. Allan Cubitt's script works great because of all of Owen's input and ideas to it. The young George MacKay gives a standout performance as the teenage son dealing with many issues. George actually has the most important and revealing scene towards the end of the movie. Would definitely recommend this film.
